intro: Calyptranthes petenensis, commonly known as the Petén calyptranthes, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
